What is overfitting in machine learning?
Supervised Learning: When a model performs well on training data but poorly on unseen data
Unsupervised Learning: When a model performs poorly on both training and unseen data
Reinforcement Learning: When a model is too complex and requires too much data to train
Deterministic Programming: When a model is too simple and cannot capture the underlying patterns in the data

Supervised Learning: To evaluate the performance of a machine learning model
Unsupervised Learning: To train a machine learning model
Reinforcement Learning: To select the best hyperparameters for a model

What does the term 'bias' refer to in machine learning?
Supervised Learning: The error introduced by approximating a real-world problem with a simplified model
Unsupervised Learning: The amount of data required to train a model
Reinforcement Learning: The complexity of a machine learning algorithm
Deterministic Programming: The time required to train a model

Supervised Learning: To introduce non-linearity into the model
Unsupervised Learning: To measure the performance of the network
